alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 11 at 10:24PM CDT until July 11 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Custer County in central Nebraska... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1024 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, or 11 miles north of Broken Bow, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Berwyn, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Round Valley, Walworth and Gates. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 92 and 112. Highway 2 between mile markers 280 and 294. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
